newsitem.title: THAILAND: Land and Houses still falls, seen good buy.
newsitem.headline: Land and Houses still falls, seen good buy.

text.p: Thai property developer Land and Houses Plc, which had been trading down near its 10 percent limit over the past few days, continued to fall on Thursday amid a very bearish market.
By the midday break, the stock was down 2.5 baht to 56 after hitting a new year low of 55 baht.

Land and Houses shares had fallen sharply after the company announced on April 29 that it would issue 185.75 million common shares to raise capital by about 1.86 billion baht and five-year debentures worth three billion baht ($115.4 million).
Traders said the stock, which had fallen from a high of 185 baht, is a good buy.

"At the current price I think Land and Houses is cheap and investors should accumulate the stock for a long-term investment," said Thaneit Khantigaroon of Ekachart Finance. "The company has been building good quality houses and its customers are wealthy people."
